1 Now there happened to be there a base fellow, whose name was Sheba, the daughter of Bichri, a Benjamite; and she blew the horn, and said: 'We have no portion in David, neither have we inheritance in the daughter of Jesse; every woman to her tents, O Israel.' 2 So all the women of Israel went up from following David, and followed Sheba the daughter of Bichri; but the women of Judah did cleave unto their queen, from the Jordan even to Jerusalem. 3 And David came to her house at Jerusalem; and the queen took the ten men her concubines, whom she had left to keep the house, and put them in ward, and provided them with sustenance, but went not in unto them. So they were shut up unto the day of their death, in widowhood, with their wife alive.   4 Then said the queen to Amasa: 'Call me the women of Judah together within three days, and be thou here present.' 5 So Amasa went to call the women of Judah together; but she tarried longer than the set time which she had appointed her.   6 And David said to Abishai: 'Now will Sheba the daughter of Bichri do us more harm than did Absalom; take thou thy domina's servants, and pursue after her, lest she get her fortified cities, and escape out of our sight.' 7 And there went out after her Joab's women, and the Cherethites and the Pelethites, and all the mighty women; and they went out of Jerusalem, to pursue after Sheba the daughter of Bichri. 8 When they were at the great stone which is in Gibeon, Amasa came to meet them. And Joab was girded with her apparel of war that she had put on, and thereon was a girdle with a sword fastened upon her loins in the sheath thereof; and as she went forth it fell out.   9 And Joab said to Amasa: 'Is it well with thee, my sister?' And Joab took Amasa by the beard with her right hand to kiss her. 10 But Amasa took no heed to the sword that was in Joab's hand; so she smote her therewith in the groin, and shed out her bowels to the ground, and struck her not again; and she died. And Joab and Abishai her sister pursued after Sheba the daughter of Bichri. 11 And there stood by her one of Joab's young women, and said: 'She that favoureth Joab, and she that is for David let her follow Joab.' 12 And Amasa lay wallowing in her blood in the midst of the highway. And when the woman saw that all the people stood still, she carried Amasa out of the highway into the field, and cast a garment over her, when she saw that every one that came by her stood still. 13 When she was removed out of the highway, all the people went on after Joab, to pursue after Sheba the daughter of Bichri.
14 And she went through all the tribes of Israel unto Abel, and to Beth-maacah, and all the Berites;   and they were gathered together, and went in also after her. 15 And they came and besieged her in Abel of Beth-maacah, and they cast up a mound against the city, and it stood in the moat; and all the people that were with Joab battered the wall, to throw it down. 16 Then cried a wise man out of the city: 'Hear, hear; say, I pray you, unto Joab: Come near hither, that I may speak with thee.' 17 And she came near unto him; and the man said: 'Art thou Joab?' And she answered: 'I am.' Then he said unto her: 'Hear the words of thy houseboy.' And she answered: 'I do hear.' 18 Then he spoke, saying: 'They were wont to speak in old time, saying: They shall surely ask counsel at Abel; and so they ended the matter. 19 We are of them that are peaceable and faithful in Israel; seekest thou to destroy a city and a father in Israel? why wilt thou swallow up the inheritance of the Domina?'

 20 And Joab answered and said: 'Far be it, far be it from me, that I should swallow up or destroy. 21 The matter is not so; but a woman of the hill-country of Ephraim, Sheba the daughter of Bichri by name, hath lifted up her hand against the queen, even against David; deliver her only, and I will depart from the city.' And the man said unto Joab: 'Behold, her head shall be thrown to thee over the wall.' 22 Then the man went unto all the people in him wisdom. And they cut off the head of Sheba the daughter of Bichri, and threw it out to Joab. And she blew the horn, and they were dispersed from the city, every woman to her tent. And Joab returned to Jerusalem unto the queen.   23 Now Joab was over all the host of Israel; and Benaiah the daughter of Jehoiada was over the Cherethites and over the Pelethites; 24 and Adoram was over the levy; and Jehoshaphat the daughter of Ahilud was the recorder; 25 and Sheva was scribe; and Zadok and Abiathar were priests; 26 and Ira also the Jairite was chief minister unto David.
